DataElement.preferredDefinition: The text that describes the condition or state of MMR.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The mismatch repair (MMR) system promotes genomic fidelity by repairing base-base mismatches, insertion-deletion loops and heterologies generated during DNA replication and recombination. This function is critically dependent on the assembly of multimeric complexes involved in mismatch recognition and signal transduction to downstream repair events.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: The mismatch repair (MMR) system promotes genomic fidelity by repairing base-base mismatches, insertion-deletion loops and heterologies generated during DNA replication and recombination. This function is critically dependent on the assembly of multimeric complexes involved in mismatch recognition and signal transduction to downstream repair events.

Concepts.definition: The mismatch repair (MMR) system promotes genomic fidelity by repairing base-base mismatches, insertion-deletion loops and heterologies generated during DNA replication and recombination. This function is critically dependent on the assembly of multimeric complexes involved in mismatch recognition and signal transduction to downstream repair events.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The mismatch repair (MMR) system promotes genomic fidelity by repairing base-base mismatches, insertion-deletion loops and heterologies generated during DNA replication and recombination. This function is critically dependent on the assembly of multimeric complexes involved in mismatch recognition and signal transduction to downstream repair events._A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates that no positive loci have been detected in the microsatellite instability (MSI) biomarkers in a sample.

Concepts.definition: Indicates that no positive loci have been detected in the microsatellite instability (MSI) biomarkers in a sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Genomic instability associated with the presence of hypermutability in specific genetic marker regions resulting from defective DNA mismatch repair.

Concepts.definition: Genomic instability associated with the presence of hypermutability in specific genetic marker regions resulting from defective DNA mismatch repair.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that a cellular sample has a functional loss of a protein involved in the DNA mismatch repair process.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that a cellular sample has a functional loss of a protein involved in the DNA mismatch repair process.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates that normal concentrations of unmutated mismatch repair proteins have been detected in a sample.

Concepts.definition: Indicates that normal concentrations of unmutated mismatch repair proteins have been detected in a sample.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

This function is critically dependent on the assembly of multimeric complexes involved in mismatch recognition and signal transduction to downstream repair events.:A condition or state at a particular time.
